item.title: Famitsu Sales: 3/10/25 – 3/16/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/famitsu-sales-3-10-25-3-16-25

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Monster Hunter Wilds moves another 40,632 retail units.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of March 10, 2025 to March 16, 2025.

Monster Hunter Wilds for PlayStation 5 remained the top selling game, moving an additional 40,632 retail units.

The only new title to chart in the top 10 was Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Familia Myth – Fullland of Water and Light for Switch, which opened at 2,524 retail sales.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 27,898 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 27,863 units, the Xbox Series family sold 333 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 19 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [PS5] Monster Hunter Wilds (Capcom, 02/28/25) – 40,632 (742,869)
  2. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) – 8,772 (1,228,548)
  3. [NSW] Suikoden I & II HD Remaster: Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars (Konami, 03/06/25) – 7,330 (46,214)
  4. [NSW] Donkey Kong Country Returns HD (Nintendo, 01/16/25) – 6,938 (232,050)
  5. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 5,851 (3,832,963)
  6. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 5,590 (6,283,003)
  7. [NSW] Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet (The Pokemon Company, 11/18/22) – 4,351 (5,538,030)
  8. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 3,794 (8,089,216)
  9. [NSW] Super Smash Bros. Ultimate (Nintendo, 12/07/18) – 3,048 (5,732,749)
  10. [NSW] Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Familia Myth – Fullland of Water and Light (Bushiroad Games, 03/13/25) – 2,524 (2,524) (New)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on March 21.

  1. [PS4] Kaleidoscope of Phantom Prison II (Entergram, 03/14/25) – (New)
  2. [NSW] Kaleidoscope of Phantom Prison II (Entergram, 03/14/25) – (New)
  3. [NSW] KAMITSUBAKI CITY REGENERATE (KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO, 03/13/25) – (New)
  4. [NSW] Mika and the Witch’s Mountain (Pikii, 03/13/25) – (New)
  5. [PS5] Suikoden I & II HD Remaster: Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars (Konami, 03/06/25) –
  6. [NSW] Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection (Konami, 02/27/25) –
  7. [NSW] Nintendo Switch Sports (Nintendo, 04/29/22) –
  8. [NSW] Ever 17 / Never 7 Double Pack (MAGES., 03/06/25) –
  9. [PS5] Split Fiction (Electronic Arts, 03/06/25) –
  10. [PS5] Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii (SEGA, 02/21/25) –
  11. [PS4] Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii (SEGA, 02/21/25) –
  12. [NSW] Ring Fit Adventure (Nintendo, 10/18/19) –
  13. [NSW] Super Mario Bros. Wonder (Nintendo, 10/20/23) –
  14. [NSW] Splatoon 3 (Nintendo, 09/09/22) –
  15. [NSW] Monster Hunter Rise + Sunbreak Set Best Price (Capcom, 11/16/23) –
  16. [NSW] Clubhouse Games: 51 Worldwide Classics (Nintendo, 06/05/20) –
  17. [NSW] Kirby and the Forgotten Land (Nintendo, 03/25/22) –
  18. [NSW] Luigi’s Mansion 3 (Nintendo, 10/31/19) –
  19. [NSW] Super Mario Odyssey (Nintendo, 10/27/17) –
  20. [NSW] Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 Special Price (SEGA, 11/17/22) –
  21. [NSW] Pikmin 4 (Nintendo, 07/21/23) –
  22. [NSW] The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild (Nintendo, 03/03/17) –
  23. [PS5] Sniper Elite: Resistance (Game Source Entertainment, 03/06/25) –
  24. [NSW] Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 11/14/24) –
  25. [NSW] Wizardry: The Five Ordeals (G*Spark Publishing, 02/27/25) –

Hardware Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. PlayStation 5 – 19,262 (5,606,750)
  2. Switch OLED Model – 17,439 (8,870,246)
  3. Switch Lite – 6,741 (6,489,348)
  4. PlayStation 5 Digital Edition – 4,352 (957,872)
  5. PlayStation 5 Pro – 4,249 (182,218)
  6. Switch – 3,718 (20,074,728)
  7. Xbox Series S – 236 (333,333)
  8. Xbox Series X Digital Edition – 58 (19,992)
  9. Xbox Series X – 39 (319,601)
  10. PlayStation 4 – 19 (7,929,336)

item.title: Deliver At All Costs launches May 22
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/deliver-at-all-costs-launches-may-22

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Do what it takes to deliver at all costs.

Deliver At All Costs, an action game set in 1959 that puts players in the role of a courier of unconventional cargo, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on May 22, publisher Konami and developer Far Out Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Konami:

About

Deliver At All Costs is a thrilling action game where destruction, absurdity, and intrigue collide!

The year is 1959. A time of rock ‘n’ roll, polka dot dresses, and the ever-looming dread of nuclear annihilation. Step into the shoes of Winston Green—a down-on-his-luck courier with a fiery temper and a mysterious past—as he delivers highly unconventional cargo, leaving a trail of havoc and chaos behind him, ensuring he does what it takes to Deliver At All Costs!

Key Features

  • Wreak Havoc and Destruction in the Streets – Plow through the city across highly destructible environments, wreaking havoc in a wide variety of vehicles. Take on bizarre deliveries and missions each with its own unique play style and mechanic. From delivering a giant flailing Marlin, to the disposal of an atomic bomb teetering on the edge of explosion, always expect the unexpected!
  • Journey through a Dynamic World – Explore an intricately designed world with large semi-open environments both on foot and in your vehicle. Be careful not to upset the citizens though – they will respond to your actions in the most unpredictable of ways…
  • Come for the Chaos, Stay for the Story – Amidst the chaos and destruction, embark on a story of mystery and intrigue divided into three acts, with a cast of distinct and memorable characters. Witness Winston’s journey as he spirals downward into the depths of insanity.
  • The Sights and Sounds of 1959 – Immerse yourself in the atmosphere of the 1950s with aesthetics and evocative music paying homage to the classic era. Featuring 1950s design elements, an original soundtrack, radio ads, English voice acting, and a user interface fitting of the times—all capturing the essence of what made the 1950s iconic!

Watch a new trailer and developer diary below.

Release Date Trailer

Developer Diary Episode 6: Vehicles and Locations

item.title: Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land x Tekken 8 free collaboration DLC announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/atelier-yumia-the-alchemist-of-memories-the-envisioned-land-x-tekken-8-free-collaboration-dlc-announced

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Collaboration costumes, special skills, and accessories.

Collaboration costumes, special skills, and accessories from Tekken 8 will be available as free downloadable content for Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land, publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Gust announced.

A special illustration by illustrator Benitama was released today to commemorate the collaboration. It features Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land protagonist Yumia and the mysterious fighter Reina from Tekken 8.

Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 21 worldwide.

Watch a teaser trailer below.

Tekken 8 Collaboration Teaser Trailer

English

Japanese
